thread.title: Birds Clinch Coors Light I-75 Divide Cup With 10th Straight Win
thread.title_full: Birds Clinch Coors Light I-75 Divide Cup With 10th Straight Win

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Birds Clinch Coors Light I-75 Divide Cup With 10th Straight Win
text:
Birds Clinch Coors Light I-75 Divide Cup With 10th Straight Win
The Flint Firebirds secured their victory over the Saginaw Spirit with a 5-4 win, marking their 10th consecutive win and clinching the 2025-26 Coors Light I-75 Divide Cup. Notable performances included two goals apiece from Nathan Aspinall and Jimmy Lombardi. This win also saw head coach Paul Flache tie the franchise record for head coach wins at 77. The game featured multiple lead changes, with Flint ultimately retaining momentum late in the third period. This clinch is the first for the Firebirds since the 2021-22 season.
- Flint improved to 18-6-1-0 with this win, while Saginaw fell to 8-11-3-3.
- Nathan Aspinall has scored 9 goals and 7 assists in his last 6 games.
- Flint has dominated the season series against Saginaw, going 5-0-0-0 so far.
- With three games left in the season series, Flint has clinched the I-75 Divide Cup.
The Firebirds will host the Soo Greyhounds on Saturday for the annual Teddy Bear Toss game, promoting community engagement by encouraging fans to bring stuffed animals for donation.
Bottom LineFlint's strong run continues as they clinch the Divide Cup, showcasing depth in scoring and solid coaching, positioning themselves as a formidable team as the season progresses.
Read more at chl.ca
